This card has fun interaction with the starter relic, because the block scales up exactly as much as incoming damage does. Making it slightly easier to play. Very fun bit of design. It also interacts well with a lot of the hermits kit, as discussed already
Everything you want from a starting card

As a starter card, this is going to have a significant impact on your runs, since you have it in every time, right from the beginning. It already puts you in a spot where enabling dead-on is important, and thus incentivizes taking 0 cost cards, discard effects, and concentrate, while slightly disincentivizing taking curse synergies. It's quite a solid card if you can trigger it even half the time in act 1, as the damage/block is really useful into all 3 elites, and so I often try to help it out, and hold onto memento in the far left of my hand to make triggering snapshot easier.

Turning this into a better iron wave is a pretty big deal, and worth going out of your way to enable. It functions very similarly to wallop, but you have to put in the work to trigger it. It scales very well with strength gain, bruise, and vigor (smoking barrel). On the other hand, this is a very sad card if you can't trigger it reliably, effectively another strike, which makes it hard to justify moving into curse synergies early in the run. Make sure to do the math on playing memento before this, as the extra damage/block will often be worth becoming vulnerable. The upgrade is deceptively good, effectively a +4 if you factor in the extra block, but you do need to consider how good you are at proccing dead on consistently before you go for it. If you are good at applying vulnerable then it increases the damage and the block to 12, which is excellent, and already possible early on with memento. Snapshot is a big part of hermits really strong early game, allowing them to fairly aggressively take act 1 elites. It can transition into a big block card in the late game as well if you have lots of strength gain from determination, or time it effectively with stacking vigor from smoking barrel.

It's very good with runic pyramid to get another shot at dead-on, or to wait to use the block on a turn where you need it. Quite good with ninja relics, especially shuriken, and plays well with strength gain relics like vajra, bolster rod, and especially girya. You may want to consider holding on to/buying draw potions like swift pot and gamblers brew to enable the dead-on for a critical moment, or even a pizazz potion to increase the damage/block.
Dead on has a really weird relationship with pyramid, because sometimes it just buried you dead on cards and they never get played.

I've found pyramid to be very good with dead-on, you can use the stored cards to block out the leftmost part of your hand, giving you a better chance to draw new dead-on cards in the middle, or to move them into the middle after playing a card draw effect. If you can clear your hand out (strong energy generation, lots of 0 costs, discard effects) then you can also use pyramid effectively to get another chance at playing a dead-on card for full value on a later turn even if it's in the wrong position right now.
I feel like 0 cost decks don't really need pyramid (only good use case I can think of is keeping a LotD) and it also anti-synergizes with lone wolf
and if you use combo you'll often hit the 10 card limit at the next turn. Plus curses become so much worse. I don't see the vision.
If it works it works, I just haven't personally made it work.
Mainly just <called shot> really
